alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Greer; Jackson; Kiowa; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 3:28AM CDT until July 09 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Jackson County in southwestern Oklahoma... Central Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northern Tillman County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Greer County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 415 AM CDT. * At 327 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Mountain View to near Humphreys, moving east at 40 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR Roosevelt, Snyder, Indiahoma, and Lawton. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Locations impacted include... Lawton, Altus, Frederick, Cache, Elgin, Apache, Snyder, Fletcher, Cyril, Tipton, Blair, Olustee, Chattanooga, Mountain Park, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Roosevelt, Manitou, Martha, and Faxon. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Comanche; Greer; Jackson; Kiowa; Tillman
